title: Cast a Spell
subtitle: Cast time of 1 reaction
description: Cast a spell with a casting time of 1 reaction.
bullets: Trigger: As specified by the spell's description.
Examples: Shield triggers when you are hit by an attack, Counterspell triggers when you see a creature casting a spell, and Feather Fall triggers when you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls.

title: Identify a Spell
subtitle: Identify a spell being cast
description: Use your knowledge of the arcane to identify a spell as it is being cast.
bullets: This was an optional rule in XGE, now a standard rule.
Trigger: A creature you can see casts a spell or you encounter a magical effect.
Reaction or Action: Make an Intelligence (Arcana) check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level.
On a success, you identify the spell if you are reacting to its casting, or you learn the properties of a magical effect if you are studying it with an action.
This allows you to decide whether to use Counterspell effectively.

title: Opportunity Attack
subtitle: Enemy leaves your reach
description: You can make a melee attack against a foe that leaves your reach.
bullets: Trigger: A hostile creature you can see moves out of your reach.
Reaction: You make one melee attack against the provoking creature.
The attack interrupts the creature's movement, occurring right before it leaves your reach.
You don't provoke an opportunity attack when you Teleport or when someone or something moves you without using your movement or action.
The Disengage action prevents you from provoking opportunity attacks for the rest of your turn.

title: Readied Action
subtitle: Part of your Ready action
description: Execute the activity specified by your Ready action.
bullets: Trigger: The perceivable circumstance you defined when you took the Ready action on your turn.
Reaction: You perform the action, bonus action, or move you chose to ready. This occurs immediately after the trigger finishes.
If you ready a spell, you cast it on your turn but use your reaction to release it. This requires Concentration, which can be broken.

title: Parry*
subtitle: Defend against a melee attack
description: Add a bonus to your AC against one melee attack that would hit you. This rule is an adaptation of NPC abilities for player use.
bullets: (Optional Rule â€“ DMG):
Trigger: Another creature hits you with a melee attack.
Reaction: You must be able to see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
You add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss.
This rule is based on the Parry reaction available to many martial NPCs.

title: Grapple Opportunity Attack **
subtitle: Stop an enemy from fleeing
description: A house rule allowing a creature to attempt a Grapple in place of a damage-dealing Opportunity Attack.
bullets: (Uncommon Homebrew Rule):
Trigger: A hostile creature you can see moves out of your reach.

RAW: An Opportunity Attack is 'one melee attack'. Because the 2024 Grapple is an Unarmed Strike (a type of melee attack), this is now arguably Rules As Written, though DMs may rule that the 'special' nature of the Grapple attack prevents its use here.
Homebrew: The DM explicitly allows you to make an Unarmed Strike to Grapple instead of dealing damage, potentially stopping the creature by imposing the Grappled condition (Speed 0).

title: Dive for Cover **
subtitle: Dodge an area effect
description: A house rule that allows a creature to use their reaction to avoid area-of-effect damage.
bullets: (Rare Homebrew Rule):
Trigger: You are subjected to an effect that requires you to make a Dexterity saving throw (like a Fireball).
Reaction: You can use your reaction to dive for cover.
Effect: You gain Advantage on the Dexterity saving throw. After the save, you land Prone.
